headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: How To Eat Healthy; Interview With Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser; Interview With Sen. Alex Padilla (D-CA). Aired 11:30a- 12p ET

utterances.speaker: ABBY PHILLIP, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I know you probably agree with her on that. She's going to address the border, which Trump has actually tried to weaponize against her. But how can she make a case that she actually can handle the border, in addition to describing Trump's policies, however they are?I mean, I think voters want to know, can she stop what they see as an uncontrolled flow at the southern border? SEN. ALEX PADILLA (D-CA): Look, I appreciate the question. It is timely. And it's also clear, not just the contrast of what you will get under Trump, mass detentions, mass deportations, chaos and fear in communities across the country, let alone the economic impact of that. But under Vice President Harris, we have already seen a significant drop in the number of people coming to the southern border, mostly to seek asylum, others not, because of her leadership and our engagement with Mexico and other countries in the hemisphere. What we're also going to get through Vice President Harris, when she becomes president of the United States, is a more thoughtful, holistic solution. We do need to address the border. Everybody of all political stripes wants a safe, secure, orderly border. But we also need to address the root causes of migration, what's causing so many people to want to come to United States. We're only going to address that through continued engagement with allies. And we cannot, President Harris will not forget about dreamers, farmworkers, other long-term residents of the United States who happen to be undocumented, but are contributing so much to the success of their communities and our country.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: We have been talking a lot about the theme of freedom that was on display last night and most of the nights here at the DNC.Last night, J.D. Vance spoke to my colleague Jake Tapper, and he criticized Democrats. He said that there's an attempt to distract from the issues that voters care about. Listen to what he said. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) SEN. J.D. VANCE (R-OH), VICE PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: So what you see from the Democrats is instead this argument that, if you want to vote for Donald Trump because you want to change the direction of this country, you're somehow a bad person. And I really think that that dark message really doesn't gel at all with the idea that somehow the Democrats are the joyful party. There's a lot of attacks on Donald Trump, a lot of criticisms of what he's done and what he's said, not a whole lot of positive vision for how Kamala Harris is going to fix the problems that plague the country. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Your response?

utterances.speaker: PADILLA
utterances.sentences: My reaction to that?

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PADILLA
utterances.sentences: I mean, he's suggesting that we're trying to distract?That's all Donald Trump tries to do. There is no vision from the Republican Party or their ticket. And so he's the one trying to distract, debating crowd sizes, belittling people. If he spent as much time trying to help people as he does trying to come up with nicknames for political rivals, maybe they'd have something more to show for it. What we're seeing on the Democratic side is not just the energy of hope and optimism, but specific, concrete ideas that build on the success of the last four years. To think that we're at this point with record low sustained unemployment, inflation going down, record job creation, more people with access to health care and reducing the cost of prescription drugs, access to quality education, we're tackling climate change, people are feeling the benefits of that. And we want to continue that. And that's part of the energy driving the Harris/Walz ticket.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: One final thing before you go. There's -- this is not getting a lot of attention outside of these halls, but inside the convention, there have been some concerns from the uncommitted delegates that there won't be a Palestinian-American representing that part of the party on the stage at all this week.They were told no by the convention organizers and the Harris campaign. Was that the right move?

utterances.speaker: PADILLA
utterances.sentences: The -- well, I trust the campaign, their judgment. And there's a whole lot of folks who want to speak during the convention and it's a finite amount of time.I think the issue has been raised and spoken to, right? Everybody wants a cease-fire, but a cease-fire requires agreement among all parties. I think, long term, people do want peace, stability and security for everybody, not just in Israel and in Gaza, but throughout the region. And we're going to, I think, take significant steps towards that under President Harris.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: All right, Senator Alex Padilla, thank you very much for joining us. We appreciate you.

utterances.speaker: PADILLA
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: All right, coming up, this is probably not a good idea, but Matt Friend is back.Matt, who you got today?

utterances.speaker: MATT FRIEND, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: We got so many people. Tim Walz is here. Obviously, Trump is here, maybe McConnell. I have all of Congress in my head.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: There's a little set of glasses in the jacket pocket.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes, we have McConnell. Let me just show you. He's looking ready just like this all the time.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: All right, very good.

utterances.speaker: MCCONNELL
utterances.sentences: We're going to see you around.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: It's a dead ringer.We will be right back.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: There's only one guy who does the most mediocre impression of me. He fails like a dog. You know who I'm talking about, right? Who is it?

utterances.speaker: ALEC BALDWIN, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: You know, Donald, we could have been great friends.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Why'd you say this?

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.sentences: If you had just changed your course one degree.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I think you're a dog.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.sentences: All you needed was a slight change.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Alec, you were so mean to me on the show. The way you portrayed me, it was so unfair. Vice President Harris, this is Barack Obama. And I have to say that itis a thrill to be with you, all the great work you have been doing with my vice president and now your president. Thank you so much. KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES (D) AND U.S. PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: I appreciate you.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: I appreciate you even more.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Thank you. I appreciate you.(END VIDEO CLIP) (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: It's great to be here. There's -- nothing speaks comedy like politicians at the DNC. Thank you for having me.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: No shortage of material.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: No shortage.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And you're very well-known, as we were just showing there in the clip, for your Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: But you have a Tim Walz.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: A lot of people don't know. Tim Walz, now you do him.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Well, I always said, I got fired up watching the guy yesterday. We're in the fourth quarter, Jim. We got a few minutes to go in the game, but I got to tell you, you got to mind your own damn business.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Do whatever you want, but let the government stay out of your own body. And I got to tell you one last thing.When we win this dang thing, Kamala Harris going to take a big thing of Gatorade and pour it all over my face. (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I'm the best dang coach you ever seen. Ted Lasso's got nothing on me.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I'm feeling good about it. Feeling great about our chances. Bill Belichick could take a note.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: But so -- and so far, you are not choking like a dog.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm not choking like a dog, Jim.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I'm not choking like a -- you're choking like a dog, Jim.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: As always.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: You're choking like a dog, absolutely.It just comes out of us, you know?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: It does.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I think the Walz is getting better.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: The Walz is getting better, a little Minnesota.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: It certainly...

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: You got the little corn dog thing going there.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I got the Walz. I can't wait for the J.D. Vance debate. Just get off the couch J.D. and come debate me, all right? Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Now, do you have favorites?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I mean, we have seen your Andy Cohen. We have seen...

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: My personal favorite is the Howard Stern.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Now you're starting to do Bill Maher.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Oh, right. Yes, I do. I do, right? And, finally, new rule, OK, if you're going to go to the DNC, makesure your speech isn't an hour-long, OK? I mean, you know how the Oscars play you off when the speech goes too long?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: We should have that here, OK, right?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: They might have needed that for Bill Clinton last night?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: They -- I think they should have. I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: A little something.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I'm like a glorified parrot. I'm just happy to be here, CNN. Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And you're launching a new podcast.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: What can you tell us about that?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: It's called "Friend in High Places."

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I just interviewed Bill Maher. He was the first episode.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And he doesn't like it when you do...

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Oh, he doesn't. He goes, I don't hear it, right?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: So I interviewed him. It's on my Instagram @TheMattFriend and YouTube and Parler and TRUTH Social. I'm kidding, but just on the socials.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: And, yes, but I'm thrilled to talk to people and learn from you, the best in the business.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Oh, you the man.And I understand you interviewed Michael Cohen.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I did. I got to talk to Michael. I said, you betrayed me like a dog. You're a snitch. It's horrible what you did to me.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: And Michael had that kind of New York reaction to it.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes. FRIEND

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes, with Michael, you might have to drop a few F-bombs in there, not that we're going to do it on the air.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes, for sure. We can do it later, yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: But let's play a little bit of this.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: OK.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: So I'm here with failing Michael Cohen.MICHAEL COHEN, FORMER ATTORNEY/FIXER FOR DONALD TRUMP: Not failing.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Michael, you betrayed me like a dog. It is really a horrible thing, what happened. What would you like to say to my face? Because you're a snitch. It's nasty what you did. You treated me horribly, and you know what happened. What would you like to say, Mike?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Donald, enjoy prison.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow. OK.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: It's getting weird now.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I'm with the actual people. I just -- like...

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And everything is like a dog. Everything is like a dog, yes, choking like a dog.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Just don't tell Kristi Noem, OK?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Oh, man.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Do not tell Kristi Noem if it's like a dog.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And, I mean, you have started some CNN impressions?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, I have.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I think we're all cringing. We're all worried about this.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I was working on the -- kind of a David Axelrod. He kind of comes from the top of the nose. Great to be in the United Center, where my Bulls play. But, anyways...

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Is there an Anderson? Is there any -- yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Well, I can do my Andy.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes, Cohen, yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Andy talking to A.C. They're going to take some shotskis on New Year's. It's cute.Jim is really cute in person.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: He's amazing.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: And the atmosphere...

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: We're running out of time.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I like the Anderson Cooper drunk giggle when he's on New Year's. Just...(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I can't quite do it yet.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Kind of like mine.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: But I do love that guy, yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Yes. And is there -- like, is there something that you're working on, workshopping you think we should know about? What's coming?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I mean, truthfully, the news is writing itself.And it's funny because, as I prepare jokes and I make a J.D. Vance couch joke, I'm like, oh, my God, did I really just say that?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Oh, man.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: But it is just the news. I'm just kind of repeating what's happening.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: What would you do without us?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: What would I do without you? Exactly.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't live. So I'm grateful to be here. Thank you for having me on. We're doing it live.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: That's it.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: We're doing it live.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: You did not choke like a dog.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Did not choke like a dog.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: Matt, always -- and I should say, I have seen you live.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I saw you in the D.C. area. And if you get the chance...

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Should we tell them what happened?

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Because I got to reenact your famous Trump press conference.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: That was...

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: I said, we got to throw Acosta out. He's a horrible, terrible person. He's disrespectful. He's wrong. He's nasty. Get him out of here.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: There was no microphone pulling, which was good.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: There was no pulling.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I'm glad we did not do that, but, as always...

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: You're the best.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: You're the -- I mean, but people should go see you live.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: It is a big treat.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And check out the podcast.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes, check out the podcast @TheMattFriend on YouTube.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: It's the like a dog podcast.

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: It's like a dog.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: You're the best. Thank you, CNN. We love CNN. Great ratings. We love you guys.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: And on that note, thanks for joining us, Matt Friend. We appreciate it. We're going to get out while we can. [11We will be right back. (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: FRIEND
utterances.sentences: While we can. Thank you.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Among the delegates present during Tuesday's raucous ceremonial roll call here at the DNC was Washington, D.C.'s, Mayor Muriel Bowser.She used her opportunity at the microphone to push for statehood in the nation's capital. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MURIEL BOWSER (D), MAYOR OF WASHINGTON, D.C.: We know Kamala Harris will fight for our freedom and we will work together to make Washington, D.C., the 51st state. (CHEERING) (APPLAUSE) (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BOWSER
utterances.sentences: Well, Abby, thanks for having me.And I was proud to cast our votes for the next president of the United States, who has been a long time supporter of D.C. statehood. And she knows firsthand, having been living in Washington, D.C., and working with us on tough issues, how important it is, but not just important for us, but important for our entire nation, that the 700,000 taxpaying Americans of D.C. are represented in the capitol, just like every other American here.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Just to follow up on that, I mean, the opposition to statehood among Republicans has become almost existential in a way.How do you get past that? They are worried that this means their electoral -- they might become obsolete electorally if D.C. becomes a state.

utterances.speaker: BOWSER
utterances.sentences: Well, I think what we should all worry about is our democracy and the promise of our democracy.And that's that every resident -- one of the promises is that every resident who pays taxes is represented. When you come to D.C., you will see in our license plates "End Taxation Without Representation." And I think a lot of the Americans that we're talking to right here in this arena are shocked by that. Some people think we're already a state, or some people think that we aren't being taxed without representation, or that we already have two senators. So part of our mission here this week is educating American citizens. And we don't see D.C. statehood as a partisan issue. It's an issue of perfecting our democracy.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: This is going to be one of the biggest moments for Vice President Harris in her entire political life.What should the goals of her speech be tonight?

utterances.speaker: BOWSER
utterances.sentences: I think that we have all been thrilled by fiery speeches, especially from the female leaders of our party. We heard from Hillary Clinton, which I know just warmed everyone's hearts and gave us a charge to finish the job.I thought Michelle Obama's words just told us what we need to do for the next 70 days to elect Kamala Harris. We heard from Angela Alsobrooks, who's going to be a fantastic senator from Maryland. And I know what Vice President Harris will do, will tell us who she is, why she's fighting for our nation. She will share with people how she's worked hard through the ranks from a DA's office and what her plans will be for the White House. And I think what we have all seen in the last several weeks is that she's ready. She's done each job that she's been elected to with fidelity, and that's what she's going to do as president. She's strong, she's courageous, she has a moral compass, and she knows how to win. And she's going to win this race and just make sure we have a president in the White House that we're proud of.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: As you know, Mayor, Donald Trump has attacked Harris as soft on crime. He's used Washington, D.C., and a lot of other major cities. I have talked to several mayors this week on the air about this. He is using the city as the microcosm of what's wrong in terms of crime in this country.So what should that message from Vice President Harris be to address these attacks, to address the concerns that maybe many voters have about their own safety and the safety of their communities?

utterances.speaker: BOWSER
utterances.sentences: I think Donald Trump's message is a tired, old message that doesn't reflect the hard work of our police officers in communities and cities across this country. I'm in Chicago right now, and it couldn't be a more perfect experiencefor our delegates and our party to display our message. In Washington, D.C., in fact, we have driven down crime. I think we're working very hard to end this year with a historic decrease in crime. And we have got that way, not from divisive politics, but from rolling up our sleeves and getting to work. Now, I happen to have been on the stage when Donald Trump was sworn in and gave that American carnage speech. And I was shocked and appalled by his vision for America. In January 2025, we're going to have a very different inauguration for Kamala Harris.
